title: Oral History - Ione "Pinkie" Adair, part 1
creator: Schrager, Sam
description: Conversation with Ione ("Pinkie") Adair at her Moscow home February 24, 1977.  Adair survived the 1910 forest fire while homesteading in the St. Joe River area. Interviewer is Sam Schrager.  Part 1. Latah County Oral History Project was organized by Latah County Historical Society.
subject: fires; oral history
source: MG 415, Latah County Oral History Project, 1971-1985, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Oral History - Ione "Pinkie" Adair, interview 5
creator: Schrager, Sam
description: Conversation with Ione ("Pinkie") Adair at her Moscow home February 24, 1977, as well as sister Bernadine Cornelison. Women homesteaders in the timber. Experiences of 1910 fire. Friendship with father. Dr. Watkins family. Carrie Bush and Mary Borah. 2-24-77 2.5 hr 59p
subject: fires; homesteads; oral history
family origin: Parents came from Oregon and Indiana (1893); family lived in the McConnell mansion (1900-36)
occupation: County assessor, teacher, postal clerk, timber homesteader
source: MG 415, Latah County Oral History Project, 1971-1985, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

holding institution: University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
